newsitem.title: USA: AT&T signs software deal with Premenos.
newsitem.headline: AT&T signs software deal with Premenos.

text.p: AT&T Corp said Wednesday it had reached a licensing agreement with Premenos Technology Corp to provide the software needed to allow its customers to trade information with other companies over the Internet.
AT&T said it would use Premenos' Templar software to offer electronic data interchange on the Internet as part of a strategy to provide a variety of business-to-business transactions options.
It said it would also use hardware from Sun Microsystems Inc to offer the service.
Premenos' stock was trading at $16 on Wednesday, $3 7/8 higher than where it closed the day before.
AT&T said the licensing agreement with Premenos was the first step in a series of Internet transactions services it plans to offer.
It did not reveal the terms of the agreement.
AT&T and Premenos could not be reached for comment.
Based in Concord, California, Premenos provides electronic data interchange software for electronic commerce applications.
Sun Microsystems Inc makes open computing network.
